SENT.plain: The antiphospholipid syndrome has been associated with many clinical conditions since its description by GRV Hughes in 1983
The linkage to Type 1 diabetes mellitus has not been established
There have been no reports of deep venous thrombosis in association with antiphospholipid syndrome and diabetes mellitus
We present the case of an African-American teenager with multiple miscarriages, diabetic ketoacidosis, deep venous thromboses, and elevated immunoglobulin M and G anticardiolipin antibodies
We urge that clinicians consider testing for antiphospholipid antibodies when diabetic patients present with multiple miscarriages or deep venous thrombosis
